name: Wickham's Wake - Wild Luxury 3BR Oceanfront Rental
description: Enjoy wild luxury in this beautiful oceanfront rental with all the amenities of home, and access to some of best fishing and hiking on the west coast of Vancouver Island.  After a day of exploring Port Renfrew on land or sea, prepare your meals in a fully equipped kitchen or on the propane BBQ overlooking the water.  Enjoy meals family-style at the large wood dining table that seats six. There are three outdoor living areas for you to enjoy, including a fire pit under the stars.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a the Wild Coast Cottage community. There are neighbours close by. Privacy may be limited in outdoor areas.

Please note that each cottage in the neighbourhood is privately owned. If you visit at another cottage and bring dishes, chairs etc. please be sure to return them to their original cottage. Some cottages are rented like ours, but most are used only by their owners and families. Please be respectful of their privacy and property.
host_about:
Ken and Joy embarked on the journey of purchasing Handsome Dan’s from Handsome Dan and The French Girl in the summer of 2020 amongst all the chaos of covid-19. 

They were looking for a business they could call their own and benefit from all their hard work and ideas instead of seeing CEO’s and upper office management always reaping the rewards, while telling other managers and workers they needed to cut back, or there were no bonuses for the year. 

The journey here was not easy - they spent 6 months apart while trying to sell their house in Saskatchewan, and then in late April 2021 they got some wonderful news - their current tenant insurer in BC said they would cover a landlord policy for a house in SK. 

In May 2021 Ken gave away or had to throw away 98% of the household items they had collected over the years - since they were moving from a huge house in SK just over 3000 sq ft with an extra wide 2 car garage into a less than 650 sq. Ft basement suite in BC. 

The transition of purchasing Handsome Dan’s and moving halfway across the country during a pandemic none the less wasn’t the easiest but they got through and now they are excited to expand and build Handsome Dan’s vacation rental property management in Port Renfrew and across the island to help cottage owners see a return on their investment, and for guests to have an amazing experience from the time they book their vacation till the time they leave; and even after raving about the experience they had at a Handsome Dan property. 

Port Renfrew is a favourite destination for a day or overnight trip on Vancouver Island. Each visit, no matter what time of year you are consumed by the natural majesty of this little community and the breath taking earthly beauty that surrounds it. 

We invite you to stay in our cottages and enjoy a few days, or weeks any time of the year. There is much to do and see. Or simply do nothing for extended periods of time, but sit quietly and listen to the ocean.  All of the cottages are privately owned and decorated to the taste of the owners.  We invite you to check them  out and are excited to share this special place with you.

name: Jordan River's (JR's) Nest
description: Ultra modern west coast inspired retreat nestled among the trees, under big skies and the nearby ocean. This suite boasts two bedrooms, and a comfortable Queen-size sofabed. Fully outfitted kitchen with all of the essentials to create your savory and sweet. Laundry in-suite. Full bathroom in-suite with heated floors. Outdoor shower and sauna also await you. Unwind sitting by the picnic and campfire spot. Enjoy a local cafe and many beautiful beaches along this side of the coast!
neighborhood_overview:
The Pacific Marine Trail boasts something for everyone - whether you are an explorer, hiker, adventurer, biker, surf/paddle boarder, boater - there are endless places to enjoy on this side of the Island with what you love to do in your free time. Take your pick of a beach - French, Sandcut, Jordan River, China, Mystic, Sombrio or Botanical - to name a few. Fall in love with the beaches and re-connect with yourself and loved ones.

Local cafe, The Cold Shoulder, is just down the hill from us offering fresh baked goods, hot and cold drinks. The coveted Shirley Delicious is a 10 minute drive down the road featuring unique breakfast/lunch delights and special treats to take on outdoor adventures. Wood-fired pizza at Stoked (seasonal operation) makes for a delicious lunch or supper in.
host_about:
Hello and nice to meet you!!!

We are a Jordan River family that has enjoyed our property and area for the past seven years as a vacation spot and in 2017 we decided to make it our family home! Tannis and Jim have their own tales of where they have travelled in younger years,  but still feel like they are on a vacation everyday in their piece of paradise here.

Jim is an avid woodworker and would love to share his expertise with you when you visit! Tannis is a homemaker and loves all things children, cooking, baking and making each day an adventure!  

We enjoy creature comforts at home and hope you enjoy them with your stay with us!!!

name: Otter Point Cabin with Hot Tub
description:
Cozy West Coast Studio

Escape to this bright, airy studio guesthouse, just 12 km from Sooke town centre in a tranquil rural setting. Stay cozy with the glass-fronted wood-burning stove and enjoy the outdoors with a Cedar Japanese-style soaking hot tub under bistro lights and a refreshing outdoor shower. Just minutes from Gordon’s Beach, this is the perfect place to relax and soak up the serenity of the West Coast.

*outdoor shower turned off during winter months to avoid freezing pipes
neighborhood_overview: A rural setting, located at the end of a quiet residental street. A choice setting to be close to the ocean and enjoy the nearby beaches. Gordon’s Beach is just in front of us and heading west from there starts a string of beautiful beaches that you can visit all the way to Port Renfrew.
host_about:
Pursuing a life by the sea and looking forward to sharing our slice of paradise with you. We love how Airbnb has changed the way people travel and some of our favourite stays have been in Paris, Palm Springs, London and Quebec City.

What we love most about this area are the beautiful hikes through old growth forests down to the wild west coast beaches. 

Happy Travels

name: Rustic Cottage in the country *pet friendly
description: The Cottage is a delightful place to unwind as you soak in all the beauty Victoria has to offer!   Located in a rural setting just outside of the city, The Cottage provides a great escape from it all.  BBQ on the deck out back, or cuddle up in bed and watch a movie on Netflix.  Ideal for 2 guests and a pet friendly space!
neighborhood_overview:
The Horticultural Gardens of the Pacific and bird sanctuary is just a short walk across the street. We highly recommend you visit our favorite organic Bistro called Charlotte and the Quayle, with a lovely outdoor patio in the gardens and delicious organic fare! It is a 10-15 minute walk from the cottage. There are great walking trails around the area, if you want to take your dog out for some exercise! Shopping and restaurants are within 5 minutes, as is the best chai latte in town (at Cherries Bistro).

Located just 15 minutes from all the Victoria attractions, the central location is perfect for sightseeing! The cottage is easily accessible to Butchart gardens, Downtown Victoria, Wine country, beautiful beaches, fresh water lakes, the Island highway, Interurban Camosun College, the BC ferries and the airport.

Just 7 min away is Tillicum Mall with Save on Foods, restaurants, Silver City Movie theatre, Pearkes Recreation center and the Greater Victoria library.
host_about:
I fell in love with Victoria 37 years ago when we moved our family of 5 out West.  The weather, the mountains, the Inner Harbour, the ocean, fresh air, great dining, pubs, music  and the wonderful people of this city made it impossible to ever leave!  I raised our kids here, and now get to enjoy it with my 10 grandchildren (who are the best part of my life!)  

I moved onto Solid Rock Acres 30 years ago, and built this dream home with family in 2008.  When the kids moved off the property back in 2016, I decided to share this beautiful space with travellers, and it has been an amazing experience!  Meeting wonderful people from all over the world has been a highlight of hosting with Airbnb, and I look forward to meeting you!

I personally love the outdoor beauty of this area, so close to downtown, the lakes, hiking, ocean, fishing, golfing and yet on the outskirts of the city!  The heritage buildings of downtown Victoria, the many beaches and of course, Butchart Gardens are among our favourite places to enjoy with family and friends!  There are excellent wineries and breweries as well as world class dining experiences to be enjoyed!  I've shared a few of my favourites in my host manual, so check them out!

I hope you fall in love with Victoria as much as I have!  Enjoy!

name: Forest Ridge ~ Port Renfrew Retreat
description: FOREST RIDGE is an ocean-view retreat in Port Renfrew, British Columbia! Beautifully situated overlooking the ocean and forested mountains of the West Coast, this two bedroom cottage is perfect for those looking for an escape from the city, to connect with nature, and to explore one of Vancouver Island's premiere tourist destinations.
neighborhood_overview:
Port Renfrew is a blossoming destination on the West Coast of British Columbia, popular for fishing, surfing, hiking, and visiting some of Canada's largest trees.

Port Renfrew offers seasonal whale watching, swimming, fishing charters, and Big Tree tours. It is also an ideal quiet escape to relax, read, or write.

Our unit is in a cottage development with many units in close proximity, but because we are higher up it does feel very private inside.

name: Beautiful Suite by the Ocean
description:
Our home is located in the upscale Gordon Point Estates by the ocean with an adjacent Glencoe Cove - Kevatsech park. Make a surprising discovery of curved roadways and cobblestones, winding paths that take you to the beaches along the ocean. There are 12 acres of dedicated park land with ocean views and two beaches.
Just short walk to the beaches, park, and bicycle trails. We have two bicycles for you to use. You can cycle to downtown or anywhere in the city using bicycle trails.
neighborhood_overview: Gordon Point Estates is situated in one of the best neighborhoods of Victoria - Gordon Head. Just 20 min. drive to downtown, close to the University of Victoria, to Mount Douglas Park with great hiking and biking and beautiful ocean views as well as public tennis courts in Gordon Head  Convenient few minutes drive to the grocery shopping and restaurants.

name: Hummingbird enSuite-Cozy Scenic Oceanfront Estate
description: Our Hummingbird en-suite (full bathroom) has a private entrance/terrace overlooking the Sooke Basin (ocean) to the southwest (great sunsets) as well as the available hot tub. Neighbors are over 200 yards away and the property has over 400 feet of ocean frontage, a real plus for capable swimmers. The property is bisected by the Galloping Goose Trail, a scenic, much featured cycling/hiking trail extending from Victoria Harbor 55 kilometers Westward -- ideal for early morning/evening walks.
neighborhood_overview: Guests may enjoy renting paddle boards and kayaks from the Stickleback, less than a 5 minute walk West down the Trail, which also features healthy and delicious meals (open for lunch and dinner).  The 17-mile pub, a mile East down the highway, offers tasty pub food, prime rib on Saturday evening, and live entertainment on the weekend.  Both restaurants provide outdoor dining and the 17 Mile has a number of lawn games as well as a pool table outside.
host_about: My husband and I are a cosmopolitan, semi-retired professional couple who enjoy having guests that are courteous and understand the accommodation we offer is within our spacious home -- several lovely ensuites, all with an ocean view and balcony, and most with their own entrance await your enjoyment.  We take pleasure in our homes, our friends, our dog (a gentile RR), and travel.

name: Private, near seaside and amenities
description: Clean, cozy and comfortable with your own private entrance off the front patio and a fenced yard for your dog. There are two bedrooms with queen beds. One is large and includes a TV and workspace. The beds are very comfortable with natural linens. The kitchenette/dining area is well equipped and includes a single induction burner and cookware. A place to gather and enjoy complimentary coffee or tea. A newly renovated full bathroom completes the space for you and your family or friends to enjoy.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a lovely quiet walkable neighbourhood. Within minutes there are two seaside parks which are great for dogs and have off leash zones. You can catch some amazing sunsets there. The Westsong walkway takes you downtown for a longer seaside walk and conveniently passes a good pub and a waterside restaurant. The Inner Harbour ferries pick you up at different spots and can give you a tour to Fisherman’s wharf or just bring weary travellers home.
All amenities are within a block- groceries, pharmacy, liquor, fitness centre, library and a great kids water park and playground.
This location gives you easy access to downtown by car, bus or cycling. Getting out of town to the airport/ferry or wanting to head off for some hiking or west coast beaches is also easy from here to access the main routes without going through the city.
host_about: I am a nature lover and have had many west coast kayak camping adventures. Local hikes and swimming are favourite activities for me and my dogs. My garden is always full of birds. I have explored varied parts of the world and welcome travelers and the experiences they have to share. I care deeply for the earth and feel positive about the future!

Beautiful executive 4 bedroom home on Bear Mountain. This home is located near the top of Bear Mountain in a quiet, family friendly neighbourhood. name: Forest Haven BNB: Private suite and hot tub
description:
Our home is surrounded by tranquil forest. Sit on the private patio or enjoy the hot tub, while basking in the serenity of the surroundings.
We have a sweet little playhouse in the side yard for your children to enjoy.
We are close to many forest walks, the free disc golf course, (we have discs in the suite for your use), and many ocean access points a few minutes drive away. There is a park and playground at Shingle Bay, a few minutes drive away.
Pets welcome by request only.
neighborhood_overview:
Pender Island has many beautiful forest walks and hikes, as well as short walks to the beach, and longer beach walks. Enjoy watching the sunset from many ocean vantage points, such as Thieves Bay, a short drive from our house. There are concerts seemingly every weekend to attend, outdoor as well as at Hope Bay at Gather, an oceanside restaurant that serves at least 50 different teas, as well as coffee, local beer and wine from Sea Star, our local winery. Hope Bay is also the home of Pender Chocolates, which is truly a delight to visit.
The local golf course also features El Faro, a restaurant specializing in delicious tacos.
There are several food trucks to try, and of course the Saturday morning market at the Community Hall!
host_about: Being a musician, I love all the concerts and also opportunities to play piano with so many wonderful musicians on Pender.  I am so thrilled to be able to live on this beautiful island with my husband Glenn, and be a part of this amazing community!

Welcome to Victoria! Sea Breeze suite is a short stroll to Cordova Bay’s sandy beach and the famous Matticks Farm.. Golfing, cycling, beach combing are some of the activities you will find here.

Small dog may be considered.

The bike path starts at the foot of our street, it will take you into Sidney, Victoria and as far as Sooke.

We are conveniently located

8 km or 5 miles Victoria airport,

In Sidney Check out the many restaurants, brew pubs, coffee shops, movie theatre or

name: A Suite on Colquitz River
description: Spacious, simply furnished, ground level suite on the Colquitz River near Cuthbert Holmes Park, a nature sanctuary. A place to relax after your busy day.  Large backyard with private parking. Close to shopping, a large movie theatre, and easy transportation access.  A 15 minute walk to the beautiful Gorge Waterway which most tourists miss!  Convenient access to the ferries (U.S. and Canadian), downtown, Langford, Colwood, Sooke and up island.
neighborhood_overview: Close to Cuthbert Holmes Park  - a beautiful nature sanctuary - geese, ducks, heron, eagles and squirrels.... and my home is on the Colquitz River.  The river is tidal and flows to the Pacific Ocean (in front of the Empress Hotel downtown), so the tide will go in and out in front of my house.   Walk to the beautiful Gorge Waterway - 15 minutes!  Grocery stores, pharmacy and liquor stores within 5 min drive.
host_about: I love travelling and meeting new people.  For most of my career I have worked in hotels, in  different positions, the last being Sales Manager at a Vancouver, BC hotel for 26 years.   My goal is to provide my guests with accommodation at a fair price,  in a great location, and with a welcoming host!

name: Cozy Suite in Beautiful Central location
description:
This one bedroom suite invites you to relax in your own private room, and enjoy a cozy home away from home. Your private space is spacious and tastefully decorated.

There is a kitchenette outside your bedroom with a living room and kitchen area. The kitchen has a full fridge, cooktop, microwave, counter space and an island with bar stools and extra storage. Our home is 5 minutes to beautiful beaches and lakes and in a very Central location perfect for exploring beautiful Vancouver Island.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a Central location (Central Saanich), our house is 10 minutes from the airport, 15 minutes from the BC ferries, 10 minutes to the World Famous Butchart Gardens and 10 minutes to downtown Victoria.
Our neighbourhood is very family friendly, and has lots of walking trails. There is a Co-op Grocery Store, Pharmacy, Liquor store, Coffee shop, Subway and Gas Station around a 3 minute drive away. There's also a mini golf area 5 minutes away, Island View Beach is a 5 minute drive away and Elk lake is a 5 minute drive as well! You will love this Central Location. Very easy access to the Highway and so much to see within a 10 minute drive!
host_about: Mom to 3 boys, Wife, believer, adventurer, singer, writer, influencer, love different cultures, travel, experiences, love people:) Most at home in my garden or by an Ocean somewhere!

name: Oceanspray Hideaway
description: Quiet, private room with own bath, kitchenette and outdoor sitting areas. Luxurious king-size bed and cozy indoor sitting area. neighborhood_overview: Our property is in a rural area, and adjacent to a network of trails through west coast rain forest, perfect for hikes and forest bathing. Eight kilometres away is the charming town of Sidney, with lots of great restaurants, unique shopping, the Shaw Ocean Discovery Centre, and an oceanfront walk. host_about: I am an avid market gardener.   My husband and I have two grown daughters. I play piano, and love books, movies and traveling.

name: Deer Walk Cabin
description: Natural surroundings with plenty of sunshine and wildlife. Inviting two bedroom cabin to enjoy your stay on Salt Spring Island. We are located in the neighbourhood of Vesuvius. Plenty of nearby beaches, lake access and Ganges (town) all within less than 10 minutes of driving. Several ferry terminals are nearby, as well as parks and numerous hikes and walks. We are near public transport as well. Salt Spring is an agricultural community and we are surrounded by several small farms.
neighborhood_overview: Vesuvius beach is a favorite, Duck Creek Park, St. Mary's Lake, and Ganges all nearby, as well as plenty of other beaches, hikes and lakes. Vesuvius Cafe, Fernwood Road Cafe and Rendezvous Patisserie are some of our favorite spots for a coffee and treat. The Market on Saturday is amazing and a must see. There is also a farmers market on Tuesday afternoon.
host_about: I'm often found reading a book, creating with my hands or in the kitchen cooking. I'm adventurous when it comes to foods, and one day would love to be growing the majority of our food. name: Hilltop Retreat, Spacious Suite/Private HotTub/Gym
description:
A single home at the top of a private road with gorgeous views of the neighborhood. A quiet spot and short ride to Bear Mountain Resort, Spa and Golf course and within easy walking distance to The Loghouse Pub and shopping. Near lakes and hiking trails.

Suite has 2 bedrooms, a NHL hockey media room leading out to patio area and hot tub. Kitchenette for food prep with a large number of appliances and a small gym provided.

Extras on request: extra large cot, Margarita maker/ice, pizza dome
neighborhood_overview:
Parks/Walking trails
Gowland Todd (10 min) – Hiking trail that just keeps going and has some scenic views of the Saanich inlet.
Lone Tree Hill (10 min) – Good hike up to the top that is not too strenuous with some incredible views.
Mount Finlayson (10 min) – the standard for local hikers. Most other hills are compared to this one. You can go up the hill ~45-60 min or head the other way under the highway to visit the waterfall. Good place for picnics where they have a firepits and picnic tables. And check out the salmon run mid-October to December.
Lakes
Thetis Lake (5 min), Florence Lake (5 min), Langford Lake (10 min), Lake Cowichan (60 min), Sooke Potholes (50 min) – are fun spots to hike and cool off
Downtown Victoria (15-25 min depending on traffic). Lots of unique shops, restaurants, inner harbor and legislative buildings
Shopping malls – Westshore Mall, Mayfair Shopping Centre, Downtown Victoria has lots to visit

Other Highlights
host_about:
Hi, I am a Naval Technical Officer with the Royal Canadian Navy and enjoy travelling myself.  In order to keep a healthy travel budget, AirBnB has offered both hosting and stays that make travel a little bit more affordable.

I love wine and food tours both local and around the world. I also participate in the local country music festivals at Lake Cowichan and enjoy hanging out with my pet pig Penny.

It's sparkling clean, private, quiet, and south facing with views of the Olympic Mountains!
neighborhood_overview: The property is walking distance to countless different amenities that truly separate us from other locations.  We are a 45 second to one-and-a- half minute walk to multiple major bus routes including the 4, 8, 14, 22, 27, 28, a 2 minute walk to St. Michael’s University School and liquor store,  3 minute drive or bus to the University of Victoria, 3 minute walk to Camosun College, 2 minute drive to the Royal Jubilee Hospital, 4 minute walk to Hillside Mall (Thrifty Foods, Starbucks, Shopper’s Drug Mart, Tim Horton’s, Canadian Tire, many fast-food restaurants, shopping stores, pubs, restaurants, banks, medical clinics and many other amenities), walking distance to Mt. There are several parks, golf courses, recreation facilities, hiking trails, and beaches close by with countless indoor and outdoo
host_about: Hi there, my wife and I started to host on Airbnb because we enjoy meeting new people and love travelling! We are athletic, love the outdoors, and love good food, good friends and both are fortunate to have our families living in Victoria as well.  We are quiet and respectful, work full-time, and have a 19 year-old daughter.  We feel extremely fortunate to live where we live and even do touristy things around town, especially in the winter and summer.  I play ice hockey on a local team with a friend I grew up with and Tiffany loves running with friends on a regular basis.  We like strong coffee, nice wine, and walking around our neighbourhood.  We are excited to welcome you into our new home and look forward to helping you, if need be, with your visit.

neighborhood_overview:
Salt Spring Island is a captivating gem nestled in the beautiful region of British Columbia, Canada. Known for its picturesque landscapes, artistic community, and laid-back atmosphere, it has become a beloved destination for travelers seeking a peaceful escape.

Nature enthusiasts will be enchanted by the island's diverse terrain, from lush forests and serene beaches to rugged coastline and rolling hills. Hiking trails like Mount Maxwell Provincial Park and Ruckle Provincial Park offer breathtaking views of the surrounding Gulf Islands and Salish Sea.

One of the island's main draws is its vibrant arts and crafts scene. Galleries and studios showcasing local talent dot the island, offering visitors the chance to admire and purchase unique creations. The Salt Spring Island Saturday Market, bustling with artisans, farmers, and food vendors, is a must-visit for a taste of the island's creative spirit.

The island's community exudes a warm and welcoming vibe,

name: #220 - Ocean Pearl (Oceanfront )
description:
Ocean Pearl - Cozy contemporary, luxury, waterfront cottage. Sit on the deck and enjoy spectacular sunsets and million dollar views.

This 2BR corner unit cottage is pet friendly and sleeps up to 4 with 2 queen beds. There is spectacular oceanfront, marina and mountain views.

A fully equipped kitchen including gas stove, fridge, oven, microwave and dishwasher. In the living room you will find a gas fireplace, flat screen smart TV with access to Netflix (No cable) and a full 4 piece bathrooms
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighbourhood is full of fun and adventure from crashing waves and wind swept shores to sunny beaches and secret tidal pools. Dine at one of four special restaurants in the area with Coastal Kitchen and Bridgemen's Bistro being seasonal and only open during high season (April - September), the Port Renfrew Hotel and Pub is open year round and offers upscale pub fare, including Import beers and wines. Tomi's Cafe has quality home cooking and is open for breakfast and lunch almost year round.

The beach is a five minute drive and world famous Botanical beach with the spectacular tidal pools is just a 10 minute drive and a short hike away. If you get a chance, head out to the world renowned Avatar Grove to see the big knotted tree and there is Fairy Lake just 15 minutes away for a float or swim.
host_about: Hi! We are excited to have a place in Port Renfrew.  I was born and raised on Vancouver Island and love it here. We love to travel and explore new places; Europe, Mexico and Costa Rica are our favourites. We know you will want to come back again and again to this gem at the edge of the famous West Coast Trail.

description:
Long stay & monthly rates available. Please inquire!

Reserved parking spot included in the nightly rate.

Welcome to the Janion: a restored heritage building in the heart of downtown. Enjoy a modern apartment with beautiful harbour and downtown views—experience a clean and simple design, a private balcony, and a rooftop patio.

Let us show why we chose to live in this beautiful city.
neighborhood_overview: The Janion boasts a walk score of 95, making it one of the most convenient places to stay while visiting Victoria. Steps from your doorway, you will find some of the best restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops in Victoria.
host_about:
Hello! 

Welcome to my Airbnb profile. I am the host of two properties here in beautiful British Columbia. My apartment downtown Victoria is the perfect spot to celebrate an anniversary or escape for a weekend getaway. My cabin in Green Lake (Cariboo) is my family's vacation home. As a family, we have enjoyed so many amazing summers and winters at Green Lake. It is truly the most magical vacation getaway during all seasons of the year. 

My partner and I live and work in Victoria, BC. We are blessed to be able to call such a fantastic city home. 

I am committed to ensuring excellent experiences for my guests. Send me a message! I am sure you will not regret staying with me.

There is a wood burning fire pit in the backyard for night time gatherings to reminisce on the days activities and well as a gas BBQ on the back patio.
Activiites:
Fishing, Crabbing, Backpacking, Hiking, Swimming, Beach combing, Paddle boarding, Kayaking, Surfing, Storm watching.
Hiking:
Botanical Beach, Pacific Rim Park, Avatar Grove and the Lonely Doug, Fairy Lake, Lizard Lake, Sombrio Beach and more!
Guest access
Free street parking and easy access to all of the surrounding areas.
neighborhood_overview: Amenities include Port Renfrew Pub, Coastal Kitchen restaurant, Tomi's cafe and the new Gateway Marina Bistro just a 2 minute walk away.  There is also a general store open from 9am to 9pm which offers a small selection of food and liquor.  A gift shop on the Pier by the Port Renfrew Pub has a great selection of souvenir and jewelry items.
host_about: Hi! We are excited to have a place in Port Renfrew.  I was born and raised on Vancouver Island and love it here. We love to travel and explore new places; Europe, Mexico and Costa Rica are our favourites. We know you will want to come back again and again to this gem at the edge of the famous West Coast Trail.

name: #231A - Shore 2 Please - Upper Unit (Oceanviews)
description: Experience the ultimate West Coast feel in this 2 bedroom upper suite cottage with stellar ocean views off the huge balcony with propane fire pit and gas BBQ overlooking the beach, mountains and Gordon River where the West Coast Trail begins.  This UPPER LEVEL called Shore 2 Please sleeps up to 6 with 2 bedrooms (1 king and 1 queen) and sofa bed. The living room has a gas fireplace and the kitchen a gas stove.
neighborhood_overview:
If you don’t feel like cooking The Renfrew Pub, Bridgeman’s West Coast Eatery, Coastal Kitchen Café and Tomi’s Home Cooking are all a short walk away. The local General Store is about a 1km walk along Parkinson Rd and has a small selection of groceries, beer, wine and a cash machine. It’s a good idea to stock up on groceries on your way to Port Renfrew either in Sooke on your way from Victoria or in Lake Cowichan.

The list of activities in Port Renfrew are endless; seeing some of Canada’s tallest trees, getting close and personal with marine life at Botanical Beach and hiking the West Coast and Juan De Fuca trails. There is also surfing, beach combing, kayaking, beach walking, whale watching tours, winter storm watching and world class fishing.
host_about: Hi! We are excited to have a place in Port Renfrew.  I was born and raised on Vancouver Island and love it here. We love to travel and explore new places; Europe, Mexico and Costa Rica are our favourites. We know you will want to come back again and again to this gem at the edge of the famous West Coast Trail.

name: Shangrila Oceanfront vacation home(MT.Baker)
description:
Shangri-La Oceanfront Vacation home is Situated at the highest point of Pender Island exclusive Oaks Bluff, offering unparalleled 360-degree Ocean views, surrounded by 10 Acres of private natural surroundings with the ocean and sky framing your view.

The entire floor is more than 2000 Square feet for maximum 6 guests to share with the large living room, kitchen, fireplaces, sound system, surround patios, BBQ, indoor and outdoor dining area. each suite has a private patio and bathroom.
neighborhood_overview:
Pender Island offers lovely waterfront parks, rolling countryside perfect for cycling or hiking, nature trails, nine hole golf course and a 27-hole frisbee golf course, a lively arts scene, a winery, restaurants, spas, many public beach access points, boat excursions, fishing trips and much more.
For your safety, security and convenience there is a medical clinic, fire department, police office, emergency helicopter landing pad, ambulance, taxi service.
The nearby Driftwood Center offers a grocery store, bakery, pharmacy, liquor store, gift shop, post office, bank, hair salon, restaurant, Saturday Farmers Market and more.

name: Explorer's Retreat | Sauna & Bunkhouse & Fire pit
description:
Along with a bunkhouse, our cottage can sleep 6 guests, with 4 in the main cottage & 2 in the bunkhouse. The main cottage has a queen-size bed & a pull-out sofa in the family room, while the bunkhouse has one double bed.

The open living & kitchen area has everything guests need for a comfortable stay. Fully-equipped kitchen, full bathroom, TV, Apple TV, Netflix & WI-FI provided. In the living area, a cozy gas fire place and beautiful nature photographs captured by local photographer TJ Watt.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a the Wild Coast Cottage community. There are neighbours close by. Privacy may be limited in outdoor areas.

Please note that each cottage in the neighbourhood is privately owned. If you visit at another cottage and bring dishes, chairs etc. please be sure to return them to their original cottage. Some cottages are rented like ours, but most are used only by their owners and families. Please be respectful of their privacy and property.

If you don’t feel like cooking The Renfrew Pub, Bridgeman’s West Coast Eatery, Coastal Kitchen Café and Tomi’s Home Cooking are all a short walk away. The local General Store is about a 1km walk along Parkinson Rd and has a small selection of groceries, beer, wine and a cash machine. It’s a good idea to stock up on groceries on your way to Port Renfrew either in Sooke on your way from Victoria or in Lake Cowichan.
The list of activities in Port Renfrew are endless; seeing some of Canada’s tallest trees, getting clo
host_about:
Ken and Joy embarked on the journey of purchasing Handsome Dan’s from Handsome Dan and The French Girl in the summer of 2020 amongst all the chaos of covid-19. 

They were looking for a business they could call their own and benefit from all their hard work and ideas instead of seeing CEO’s and upper office management always reaping the rewards, while telling other managers and workers they needed to cut back, or there were no bonuses for the year. 

The journey here was not easy - they spent 6 months apart while trying to sell their house in Saskatchewan, and then in late April 2021 they got some wonderful news - their current tenant insurer in BC said they would cover a landlord policy for a house in SK. 

In May 2021 Ken gave away or had to throw away 98% of the household items they had collected over the years - since they were moving from a huge house in SK just over 3000 sq ft with an extra wide 2 car garage into a less than 650 sq. Ft basement suite in BC. 

The transition of purchasing Handsome Dan’s and moving halfway across the country during a pandemic none the less wasn’t the easiest but they got through and now they are excited to expand and build Handsome Dan’s vacation rental property management in Port Renfrew and across the island to help cottage owners see a return on their investment, and for guests to have an amazing experience from the time they book their vacation till the time they leave; and even after raving about the experience they had at a Handsome Dan property. 

Port Renfrew is a favourite destination for a day or overnight trip on Vancouver Island. Each visit, no matter what time of year you are consumed by the natural majesty of this little community and the breath taking earthly beauty that surrounds it. 

We invite you to stay in our cottages and enjoy a few days, or weeks any time of the year. There is much to do and see. Or simply do nothing for extended periods of time, but sit quietly and listen to the ocean.  All of the cottages are privately owned and decorated to the taste of the owners.  We invite you to check them  out and are excited to share this special place with you.

Great central location to marina, and hiking trails and surfing in the area

neighborhood_overview:
Located in a the Wild Coast Cottage community. There are neighbours close by. Privacy may be limited in outdoor areas.

Please note that each cottage in the neighbourhood is privately owned. If you visit at another cottage and bring dishes, chairs etc. please be sure to return them to their original cottage. Some cottages are rented like ours, but most are used only by their owners and families. Please be respectful of their privacy and property.


If you don’t feel like cooking The Renfrew Pub, Bridgeman’s West Coast Eatery, Coastal Kitchen Café and Tomi’s Home Cooking are all a short walk away. The local General Store is about a 1km walk along Parkinson Rd and has a small selection of groceries, beer, wine and a cash machine. It’s a good idea to stock up on groceries on your way to Port Renfrew either in Sooke on your way from Victoria or in Lake Cowichan.
The list of activities in Port Renfrew are endless; seeing some of Canada’s tallest trees, getti
host_about:
Ken and Joy embarked on the journey of purchasing Handsome Dan’s from Handsome Dan and The French Girl in the summer of 2020 amongst all the chaos of covid-19. 

They were looking for a business they could call their own and benefit from all their hard work and ideas instead of seeing CEO’s and upper office management always reaping the rewards, while telling other managers and workers they needed to cut back, or there were no bonuses for the year. 

The journey here was not easy - they spent 6 months apart while trying to sell their house in Saskatchewan, and then in late April 2021 they got some wonderful news - their current tenant insurer in BC said they would cover a landlord policy for a house in SK. 

In May 2021 Ken gave away or had to throw away 98% of the household items they had collected over the years - since they were moving from a huge house in SK just over 3000 sq ft with an extra wide 2 car garage into a less than 650 sq. Ft basement suite in BC. 

The transition of purchasing Handsome Dan’s and moving halfway across the country during a pandemic none the less wasn’t the easiest but they got through and now they are excited to expand and build Handsome Dan’s vacation rental property management in Port Renfrew and across the island to help cottage owners see a return on their investment, and for guests to have an amazing experience from the time they book their vacation till the time they leave; and even after raving about the experience they had at a Handsome Dan property. 

Port Renfrew is a favourite destination for a day or overnight trip on Vancouver Island. Each visit, no matter what time of year you are consumed by the natural majesty of this little community and the breath taking earthly beauty that surrounds it. 

We invite you to stay in our cottages and enjoy a few days, or weeks any time of the year. There is much to do and see. Or simply do nothing for extended periods of time, but sit quietly and listen to the ocean.  All of the cottages are privately owned and decorated to the taste of the owners.  We invite you to check them  out and are excited to share this special place with you.

name: The Boat Yard
description: This custom mid century style home is nestled amongst 2 acres of rainforest and beautifully landscaped food gardens. Our unique west coast hideaway features wrap around decks for sun all day, wood stove, radiant floor heating, and a covered bar for hosting. A short walk down our private trail will have you at the ocean for breathtaking sunsets. Minutes to provincial parks and numerous beaches, and a coffee shop right down the hill.
neighborhood_overview: Jordan River is 30 min from Sooke and Port Renfrew. A former logging town it is mostly known now for its rivermouth surf breaks and coffee shop. There are no stores or towns after sooke for groceries or libations until port renfrew and it’s limited at best. BYOB is a must. There is a great coffee shop on the bottom of the hill and a seasonal pizza spot in French beach.

name: Beachfront log cabin, Miners Bay, Mayne Island
description:
MayneWave is an historical beachfront log cabin (1900), on Mayne Island named for its proximity to water. Waves on the beach and a seasonal stream in winter.

The beach area was a site of First Nations settlement for millennia and was a rest point for miners traveling by canoe to the gold fields

Optimal for 2 guests (can sleep 3)
views of Miner's Bay
50 m to beach
fully renovated in 2021
full kitchen including dishwasher
fast Starlink WiFi
Apple TV
washer/dryer
private deck with views of Bay
neighborhood_overview:
The location is steeped in history and has been the site of human habitation for 3 millennia. It is easy to be entranced by imagining the past. The location also brings into focus the rhythms of our world and our synergy with nature. Wildlife abounds.
300 m to village with , bakery, two grocery stores, liquor store, gas station, historical sites and site of live concerts in the summer.
The property is 1.6 acres with expansive lawn orchard and vegetable garden.
host_about: Australian by birth. Emeritus Professor, University of Calgary. Retired 2020. Owned property on Mayne since 2009 and lived here permanently since 2019. Have four wonderful children and a dog. Have traveled widely and enjoy hosting travelers from near and far.

name: Sandy Feet Retreat- Oceanfront 2BR, modern cottage
description:
Enjoy the Magnificent views from our modern oceanfront vacation home, just steps away from the ocean!

This is a brand new, fully furnished, 2 bedroom modern vacation home in Port Renfrew (The southwest coast of Vancouver Island)

This is the perfect cottage for a staycation, family getaway, family reunion or just with friends!!
neighborhood_overview:
Port Renfrew is located just 1.5 hours from Victoria and 2 hours from Nanaimo and is popular for fishing, cycling and hiking. Surfing, paddle boarding and kayaking down the Gordon River is also very popular. There are also many places to hike and explore including the gorgeous Botanical Beach and the old growth of Avatar Grove. Whether it’s ancient tall trees, gorgeous beaches, five-star fishing, surfing, or world famous hiking along the West Coast Trail everything is steps away from your front door.
Some amenities include: a gas station, restaurant, pub, café, and general store. If you do plan on cooking some elaborate meals, it might be best to plan ahead and bring food items with you.
Another thing to note is that there is no cell phone reception. Please plan your communications accordingly and remember that we offer free Wifi within the cottage.
It is important to note that there are power outages that occur in Port Renfrew, so please be prepared. Port Renfrew is ru
host_about: I am a proud husband and father of 2 young children. Both a traveller and a host. I love fishing and the outdoors, and exploring new destinations.

Our property is brand new in December 2019. Decorated to an extremely high quality standard. The entire property is available and comfortably sleeps up to four people.

See our eaglereach Wordpress site for more information or follow us at Eagle Reach - West Coast Cottages.
neighborhood_overview: Port Renfrew is very special. Eagle Reach is perfectly located to be a base for your outdoor adventures. The local beaches and forest hikes are particular treats and you can take a fishing charter out into the Pacific waters.  Surfing is available on several nearby beaches and you can watch the weather roll by from the comfort of the balcony or living room. Local restaurants and The Renfrew Pub offer a range of dining options.
host_about: Rob and Heather live in Victoria, BC.   We are both engineers with attention to detail and quality we also have a keen interest in the environment.  We love British Columbia and we want to help to protect the beautiful West Coast environment.  For every booking that we take we make a donation to the Ancient Forest Alliance in support of their work to protect the landscape in this area.  We are also keen to highlight the work of local artists whose work can be enjoyed in our home.

name: New Listing!!!  Separate Cottage in North Saanich!
description: New Listing!!!  Separate cottage for your lovely stay in beautiful North Saanich. My spacious one-bedroom suite has everything you need for your trip to Victoria and the surrounding area.  North Saanich is a 30-minute drive to Victoria.  It is 10 minutes to the airport, Sidney by the Sea and the BC ferry to Vancouver or the Gulf Islands.
neighborhood_overview:
Deep Cove is a lovely peaceful community, with farm markets every Saturday during the summer, Friday night music events in the local church, gorgeous local beaches, tennis courts, Horth Hill regional park with viewpoints and many walking trails. The Deep Cove Winery/Bistro and the Deep Cove Chalet (a world-class French restaurant) are within 5 minutes. The local Deep Cove market has groceries and an excellent coffee bar/bistro where you can enjoy a great outdoor seating area or sit inside.
Cycling is excellent around North Saanich. You can reach 'Sidney by the Sea' by bike in 25 minutes, access the Lochside/Galloping Goose regional trail system or a 10k cycling/walking pathway around the airport. Cycle Sidney has 'rental' options. The local Recreation Center is 10 minutes away by car.
host_about: I'm Canadian and live in Victoria, BC.  I love to travel and meet new people.  I am an elementary teacher, have 3 daughters and now 5 grandchildren!  During the summer I like to travel and am happy to have people from around the world enjoy my beautiful house while they visit this amazing city I call home!

name: Sweet Home with mountain/city/ocean view
description:
Our place has city view, mountain view, and some ocean views too. It is private with your own secure yard and patio. It is close to amazing trails, tennis and golf. The trans Canada highway going north or south into Victoria is right there. Its only 15 mins easy drive into downtown Victoria. name: A Middle Room with Queen bed and mini fridge
description: Access by the front door for your pet. Surrounded by fruit trees and backed onto Swan Lake Christmas Hill Nature Sanctuary, a Saanich Park green space at this peaceful and centrally located place.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is usually very lush and green with many trees and flowers and birds that come to our sundeck. We are only a few blocks from Uptown Mall, Whole Foods, Walmart with Medical Clinic, Tim Hortons Donut Shop, Subway Sandwiches, Shoppers Drug Mart and Saanich Plaza with the Medical Clinic. You can walk on the Galloping Goose trail to Swan Lake with many different birds and flowers along the way.
host_about:
Helping people learn about Victoria, healthy living, organic food, trying some gluten free recipes and others, plus vitamins.  I like to cook healthy food to keep me energetic.  We love to learn about all the corners of the world over the dinner table. 

We currently have several rooms for homestay students.  Please book as soon as possible. The rooms book up very quickly because the students tell their friends or bring them over and they want to move in as well.

We are only 3 minutes walk down two blocks to the bus, and it is only 10 minutes on the bus to town. We have a beautiful 45 minute hike around Swan Lake just outside our front window. We have shopping within walking distance, a couple of blocks down at the brand new Uptown Mall.

name: Trails End Retreat
neighborhood_overview: Port Renfrew is small village on the southwestern edge of Vancouver Island. Even though it's less than two hours from downtown Victoria, Port Renfrew is a remote outpost with only 250 year round residents, plus the residents of the nearby Pacheedaht First Nation. Our condo is "centrally located" in that the Renfrew Pub is a 10 minute walk one way and Bridgeman's is 5 minutes the other way (these are the two year-round places to eat and drink in Port Renfrew). In the summer, several other eateries open nearby. It is also a short drive to the General Store, the gas station, Pacheedaht Beach and Botanical Beach.
host_about: I am both a traveller and a host. While I love exploring new places, my real joy is helping people experience the wild west coast of Vancouver Island.

name: The Loft - Lux Chic Suite | Heart of Downtown
description:
Welcome to "The Leiser Loft." This trendy 1Bed/1Bath heritage loft in the heart of Lower Yates, steps to some of the best restaurants the city has to offer and bordering the historic Wood Brick Laid Waddington Alley. Originally built in 1896 by Simon Leiser this heritage building was converted into gorgeous lofts in 2008 by developer Chris LeFevre

-1Bed/1Bath + Pull Out Couch
-Stocked Kitchen
-Amazing Shared Rooftop Patio
-Smart TV
-Downtown Location
COV# 00038445
neighborhood_overview: Anytime of year Victoria is a great place to visit, from balconies, to Parades, and Canada day. The capital of B.C. has it all and loves to entertain. Enjoy walks along Dallas road, a water taxi up the gorge. Located on South Yates this beautiful character loft offers easy access to some great restaurants and waterways for some beautiful sunset strolls.
host_about: I'm a fun energetic professional from Vancouver, Canada. I'm always looking for the next adventure and love to travel and experience anything new.

name: Beach Front Oasis 15 Minutes To Downtown Victoria
description:
Welcome to my nature sanctuary cozy 2 bedroom ocean-front suite.

The house is located at the famous Esquimalt Lagoon and offers a lovely outside space over looking the Juan de Fuca straight with amazing views of the ocean and Olympic mountains.

Enjoy the peaceful surroundings and breathtaking views and the convenience of being only 15-20 minutes from Downtown Victoria.

Reserve your dates today and start planning a rejuvenating retreat by the sea!
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in Colwood at the breath taking Esquimalt Lagoon.

For bird lovers you are next door to the Esquimalt Lagoon Migratory Bird Sanctuary.

Just minutes away from Roads University.

The thriving city of langford is a quick 5 minutes drive away.

Downtown Victoria is a 15-20 minutes drive from the house.
host_about:
Hello! I am Jayne Percy.
There is nothing i enjoy more than traveling a having a place to call home when i am away. 
The next best thing is providing this to others when visiting our Beautiful city.

name: Guest Suites on Benvenuto ( Loft )
description:
Welcome to Guest Suites on Benvenuto. This charming farm style one bedroom suite, is tucked away in the quiet community of Brentwood Bay. The property is over an acre in size and borders a 10 acre park which is accessible right out your back door.
There is free parking for guest as well on site. This suite you are looking at now is our LOFT suite in the centre with a balcony. It is our biggest of the three suites that we offer.
neighborhood_overview: The beautiful Butchart Gardens is less the 1km away from your stay. Also close by is the Brentwood Bay spa and lodge as well our local coffee shops.
host_about:
Husband to an amazing wife and father to three lovely boys 11,9 and 7. I love nature and generally being outside. This property is my pride and joy and I hope your stay here will be one of relaxation and a peaceful place to recharge in nature. 
I don’t currently live on site, but I am very close by to assist with any needs that should arise.

name: Deluxe Single suite
description:
The Craigmyle is a heritage building.
Elegant, inviting, and completely unique – The Craigmyle redefines boutique hotel living in the heart of Victoria, BC. Tucked away in one of the city’s gorgeous residential neighborhoods, just two minutes from the historic Craigdarroch Castle, our hotel places the city’s top attractions at your doorstep, while maintaining a sense of calm and tranquility that sure to relax and inspire you.
neighborhood_overview:
The Craigmyle is located in Rockland, one of Victoria's most beautiful, residential neighbourhoods. Surrounded by other heritage buildings and with Craigdarroch Castle in our backyard you enjoy a peaceful and relaxing stay. Downtown is a 20 minutes walk or 10 minutes bus ride away. Within just a short stroll you reach Government House with its beautiful gardens. Parking is available for free on Craigdarroch Road.

Enjoy our prime location. You will for sure be satisfied!

name: Superior King Room
description:
The Craigmyle is a heritage building.
Elegant, inviting, and completely unique – The Craigmyle redefines boutique hotel living in the heart of Victoria, BC. Tucked away in one of the city’s gorgeous residential neighborhoods, just two minutes from the historic Craigdarroch Castle, our hotel places the city’s top attractions at your doorstep, while maintaining a sense of calm and tranquility that sure to relax and inspire you.
neighborhood_overview:
The Craigmyle is located in Rockland, one of Victoria's most beautiful, residential neighborhoods. Surrounded by other heritage buildings and with Craigdarroch Castle in our backyard you enjoy a peaceful and relaxing stay. Downtown is a 20 minutes walk or 10 minutes bus ride away. Within just a short stroll you reach Government House with its beautiful gardens. Parking is available for free on Craigdarroch Road.

Enjoy our prime location. You will for sure be satisfied!

name: Ocean Breeze Cottage, Peaceful, Renovated +Nr Town
description: Looking for an affordable, clean, rural retreat within sight of the ocean for a few days? Then you’ve found it.  Ocean Breeze Cottage on Salt Spring Island is newly renovated, & sleeps up to 6.  You get the whole place to yourselves.  All within easy reach of Ganges Village and local beaches and lakes.  Your own private sanctuary, with indoor-outdoor living.  And new modern appliances: range, fridge, washer-dryer, and a well-equipped kitchen.  Some breakfast basics and fixings are also included.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located a 4-minute drive from Ganges Village, the main centre of Salt Spring. We are on a quiet local road which runs parallel to the coast and you can see glimpses of the ocean from the property.

You can take a gentle stroll along our tranquil road, or, if you are more energetic, we are only a few minutes drive from several hiking trails.

Ample parking is available for 2-3 vehicles.
host_about:
My family and I have lived on Salt Spring after moving from Vancouver in 2007.  We enjoy kayaking, sailing and hiking among other pursuits.  We are remote workers, owning an elearning business (www.sparkandco.ca) and 2 international properties in Mexico (www.oceanbreezeakumal.com) and Panama.

We're grateful to be able to offer others the opportunity to visit and explore our beautiful island by staying in a our guest cottage.

description:
This bright and beautiful suite sits directly on the ocean with access to our dock. Newly updated with stunning views and peaceful surroundings. Under 30 minutes to Victoria's City Centre, and only a 10-15 minute drive to the world famous Butchart Gardens. This place makes you feel like you’re miles away yet conveniently close to everything this amazing city has to offer.

*Please note that a new house is being built next door, so there may be residential construction noise during the day.
neighborhood_overview: Near the town of Brentwood Bay, you are close to great coffee shops, restaurants, kayaking, great walking trails, and all the necessities. Durrance Lake is 5 minutes away for swimming and a lovely short walk. At the end of our road are hiking trails through Gowlland Tod  Provincial Park. Mount Work Regional Park is 5 minutes down the road  for the more adventurous mountain bikers and hikers.
host_about:
I am from Europe and have lived in beautiful Victoria, BC for over 27 years with my family. We love hiking, kayaking and playing pickle ball at the local public outdoor court. We enjoy travelling to different places but always love to come home to the tranquillity and spectacular views from our deck. 
 
We live on the property and respect your privacy. We are available by phone if you need anything to make your stay more enjoyable.

name: Oceanfront , dock, beach access, paddle boards
description: This historical oceanfront cottage has been tastefully renovated. It has a large deck surrounded by beautiful plants and fruit trees with a view of the Sooke basin. There is a dock on the property as well as stairs to the beach. We have 2 paddle boards for use and can provide fishing charters upon availability and request. The galloping goose trail is mere steps away for cyclists and the sea to sky regional park, a couple blocks away, offers 57 km’s of mountain biking and hiking trails. Welcome!
neighborhood_overview: The galloping goose trail is steps away and The sea to sky regional park is great for hiking and biking. There are lots of places to eat close by and our favourite coffee shop is the stick in the mud which is a short 5 minute drive away. Sooke is a quaint little town with lots of outdoor exploring. The Sooke potholes is a short drive away and a majestic spot for swimming, sunbathing and exploring.
host_about: Hello potential guests. My name is Michelle and I live with my family in beautiful Sooke BC. I was raised on this incredible island and love getting out for adventures with my family and two dogs. When I’m home you can find me cooking or in my yard soaking in the fresh sea air. I hope you’ll find your stay on this property as enchanting as I do.

name: The Seaview Cottage  -The Hen and Hound Farm
description: A cozy and bright 2 bedroom, 1 bath ocean side cottage B&B situated on the scenic Walker’s Hook Road on Salt Spring Island with private covered ocean front boat house and secluded beach. Breakfast provided, our guests receive coffee, teas, a bottle of our house cider and our fresh pastries during their stay.
neighborhood_overview: Walkers Hook Road is a scenic destination for biking, walking and includes the Fernwood pier along with restaurants and cafes.
host_about:
We are a little family with big hearts who live on a tiny island and run a small farm. 

Jason and Rochelle have been married for 3 years and have one toddler, Munro and one baby, Mae. We spend our days working on our farm, hosting our guests and enjoying our island life with our 12 hens and 4 dogs. We have two big Irish wolf hounds; Hamish and Beowulf, and two small senior rescues, Ferdinand and Ludwig.

We love food, wine, coffee, playing on the beach, swimming in the sea and snacking in our garden. 

We can’t wait to show you all the spoils of our magical 30 acre property with our private 3 acre ocean front beach. 

Welcome to The Hen and Hound Farm and Accommodations on Salt Spring Island.

name: Stunning private oceanfront getaway experience
description:
Welcome to your private oceanfront getaway
Nestled in a (distanced) private area of our property awaits this 40 foot rustic/industrial style converted bus.
Take in the ocean view of the Sooke Basin and the mountains of Washington state across the strait of Juan De Fuca.

Enjoy a visit from our dog, Argo, who lives on the property and loves our guests.

During fair weather you can enjoy the immediate beach access, go for a light kayak on the ocean.
Check our IG @sookeskibus
neighborhood_overview: Saseenos in a relatively warm area of Sooke.  We have our own micro-climate created by the Sooke Basin which provides ideal conditions for growing fruit and vegetables.  This area of Sooke was utilized in the early 1900s for farm land and orchards.  You will still see many properties in the area with Apple, Pear, and cherry trees.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Dan
I own and operate the Sooke Ski bus and I live on the property.  I am usually around so if you ever need anything during your stay, im close and ready to help.  

Hope to see you soon :)

name: Room by the river near Potholes/Galloping Goose
description:
Across from the Galloping Goose Trail and just a short walk to the Sooke Potholes. A lovely self-contained, clean and safe place to enjoy nature or use for peaceful meditation right in front of the Sooke River. You will hear the sounds of the water passing by and the birds singing. Hummingbirds, deer and other wildlife visit here. The perfect place to relax and enjoy a vacation in nature yet close enough to the city of Victoria to enjoy both.
Car parking onsite - no trailer or RV parking.
neighborhood_overview: We live in a very secluded area yet not too far away from the hustle and bustle of Sooke (a 5 minute drive) or a bit further to get to Victoria. Our home is a short walk away from the Sooke Potholes, hiking/biking trails, and an easy drive to gorgeous rain forest and beach fronts. The Galloping Goose Trail runs parallel to our property.
host_about: Love to travel and be immersed in nature. I am so fortunate to have woods, rivers and the Pacific Ocean all very close to where I live.

name: High Tide Hideaway - Private treed setting
description:
High Tide Hideaway is a modern cottage located in a private treed setting. The driveway leads to a stunning private fire pit & seating area. Inside, a roomy well-equipped kitchen w/propane cooking stove. The bright living room is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows, giving the feeling of being outside, yet warm & cozy by the electric fireplace. It offers a double sofa bed, a smart TV connected to Netflix. Down the hall, a Queen BR & full bath.

****Note there are no curtains in living room.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a the Wild Coast Cottage community. There are neighbours close by. Privacy may be limited in outdoor areas.

If you don’t feel like cooking The Renfrew Pub, Bridgeman’s West Coast Eatery down at the marina, Coastal Kitchen Café and Tomi’s Home Cooking are all a short walk away. The local General Store is about a 1km walk along Parkinson Rd and has a small selection of groceries, beer & wine. It’s a good idea to stock up on groceries on your way to Port Renfrew either in Sooke on your way from Victoria or in Lake Cowichan.

The list of activities in Port Renfrew are endless; seeing some of Canada’s tallest trees, getting close and personal with marine life at Botanical Beach and hiking the West Coast and Juan De Fuca trails. There is also surfing, kayaking, beach combing, whale watching, storm watching and world class fishing.
host_about:
Ken and Joy embarked on the journey of purchasing Handsome Dan’s from Handsome Dan and The French Girl in the summer of 2020 amongst all the chaos of covid-19. 

They were looking for a business they could call their own and benefit from all their hard work and ideas instead of seeing CEO’s and upper office management always reaping the rewards, while telling other managers and workers they needed to cut back, or there were no bonuses for the year. 

The journey here was not easy - they spent 6 months apart while trying to sell their house in Saskatchewan, and then in late April 2021 they got some wonderful news - their current tenant insurer in BC said they would cover a landlord policy for a house in SK. 

In May 2021 Ken gave away or had to throw away 98% of the household items they had collected over the years - since they were moving from a huge house in SK just over 3000 sq ft with an extra wide 2 car garage into a less than 650 sq. Ft basement suite in BC. 

The transition of purchasing Handsome Dan’s and moving halfway across the country during a pandemic none the less wasn’t the easiest but they got through and now they are excited to expand and build Handsome Dan’s vacation rental property management in Port Renfrew and across the island to help cottage owners see a return on their investment, and for guests to have an amazing experience from the time they book their vacation till the time they leave; and even after raving about the experience they had at a Handsome Dan property. 

Port Renfrew is a favourite destination for a day or overnight trip on Vancouver Island. Each visit, no matter what time of year you are consumed by the natural majesty of this little community and the breath taking earthly beauty that surrounds it. 

We invite you to stay in our cottages and enjoy a few days, or weeks any time of the year. There is much to do and see. Or simply do nothing for extended periods of time, but sit quietly and listen to the ocean.  All of the cottages are privately owned and decorated to the taste of the owners.  We invite you to check them  out and are excited to share this special place with you.

name: Carpenter Suite
description: The Carpenter Suite is a four-season escape brimming with natural abundance in the heart of the Vancouver Island rainforest. This bright, cozy and spacious suite is a well-kept secret that is year-round refuge. Our space is on a private 5 acre property. We also guarantee time to recharge no matter the weather and find our space is the ultimate getaway from the city!
neighborhood_overview: We are 10 minutes outside of Sooke. Our property exudes all of the charm of a rural abode with the simplicity of being close to town.

name: SALT Oceanfront Cottage!
description: We call it "SALT" (sister cabin is Pepper :)) and it's a self-contained sweet cottage nestled between the woods and sandstone waterfront. We are located on the south end of Galiano and just next to Morning Beach (a sandy favourite). The cottage offers a stellar view, oceanfront and a 2 bedroom new build that could sleep up to 4 comfortably. We are currently offering short term and discounted longer term rentals for anyone interested in 30 days or more.
neighborhood_overview: Galiano Island is a 55 minute ferry ride from Vancouver's ferry terminal in Tsawassen. Our property is close to Morning Beach and the Faerie Pool and only 4km from the Sturdies Bay Ferry Terminal and 2km from the stores.
host_about: We are a family of 5 and think Galiano Island and Vancouver are pretty amazing spots! We hope you can come and enjoy them as much as we do.

name: Superior queen room #1
description:
The Craigmyle is a heritage building.
Elegant, inviting, and completely unique – The Craigmyle redefines boutique hotel living in the heart of Victoria, BC. Tucked away in one of the city’s gorgeous residential neighborhoods, just two minutes from the historic Craigdarroch Castle, our hotel places the city’s top attractions at your doorstep, while maintaining a sense of calm and tranquility that sure to relax and inspire you.

name: Ocean Front Retreat with Stunning Water Views
description:
The Boathouse is perfect for couples seeking a romantic retreat or solo travelers wanting to unplug and recharge their batteries. This 1 bedroom cottage is nestled on the hillside at the water’s edge. As you walk the steps down to the private cottage take in the panoramic ocean views. It has recently been renovated from top to bottom.

*Please note that a new house is being built next door, so there may be residential construction noise during the day.
host_about:
I am from Europe and have lived in beautiful Victoria, BC for over 27 years with my family. We love hiking, kayaking and playing pickle ball at the local public outdoor court. We enjoy travelling to different places but always love to come home to the tranquillity and spectacular views from our deck. 
 
We live on the property and respect your privacy. We are available by phone if you need anything to make your stay more enjoyable.

name: Quiet Romantic Getaway at Wild Coast Lure
description:
★ Wild Coast Lure ★ is a beautiful little gem that will take your breath away. Relax in the ultimate getaway as you are tucked away in a quiet corner of the cottage community.

Feel the serenity of the rainforest around you as you lounge on the deck chairs on the front deck. A bbq and wood fire pit complete your little oasis, accessible from either your front door or bedroom patio.

Great couples getaway cottage

★ Be sure to save to your Wishlist ★
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a the Wild Coast Cottage community. There are neighbours close by. Privacy may be limited in outdoor areas.

Please note that each cottage in the neighbourhood is privately owned. If you visit at another cottage and bring dishes, chairs etc. please be sure to return them to their original cottage. Some cottages are rented like ours, but most are used only by their owners and families. Please be respectful of their privacy and property.


Port Renfrew, British Columbia, Canada
If you don’t feel like cooking The Renfrew Pub, Bridgeman’s West Coast Eatery, Coastal Kitchen Café and Tomi’s Home Cooking are all a short walk away.

The local General Store is about a 1km walk along Parkinson Rd and has a small selection of groceries, beer, wine and a cash machine. It’s a good idea to stock up on groceries on your way to Port Renfrew either in Sooke on your way from Victoria or in Lake Cowichan.

The list of activities in Port Renf

name: Charming Log Home - With Cozy Fireplace & Hot tub
description:
Come and relax in our (3BRw/loft) traditional log home, featuring a fully equipped kitchen, with gas range, cableTV & DVD player. Bathroom includes a large bath tub, separate shower & laundry facilities. The 17ft high stone fireplace will gather friends & family for memorable cozy nights. Outside, enjoy private hot tub, BBQ, propane fire pit, table and chairs. Great views of the Strait of Juan de Fuca from upper sitting area.
Our log home can accommodate up 8 people with a maximum of 6 adults.
neighborhood_overview:
3 min walk to public beach access.
10 min drive to the first of many provincial park beach.
45 min drive to Victoria
1h drive to Port Renfrew famous Avatar Gove and Botanical Beach
Sooke also offers a few micro brewery/winery to visit. as Sooke Pothole is a must see.

name: River front near Potholes/ Galloping Goose Trail
description:
This river view cabin is a great meditation spot, silent retreat, artist retreat, or your “get away from it all” kind of place. Working remote from here is also an option.
Featuring a private entrance, this top cabin is fully yours.
Sip your coffee in front of the river in the morning.
The cabin contains 1 bedroom with a queen bed, living room with a futon turning into a double sofa bed, kitchen with dishwasher, deluxe bathroom and work area.
Car parking onsite - no trailer or RV parking.
neighborhood_overview: This cabin is situated a few km away from the Sooke Potholes - it is away from the city yet still close enough if you want a change of pace.
host_about: Love to travel and be immersed in nature. I am so fortunate to have woods, rivers and the Pacific Ocean all very close to where I live.

name: Modern Condo in Heritage Inspired Bldg w/Parking
description: In the heart of Victoria's old town district. Steps from incredible dining, shopping, the famous Inner Harbour, & more! This studio features carefully selected finishings to create a modern yet comfortable atmosphere. The built-in high quality Murphy bed functions as a dining table/work station during the day. South facing views over old town w/ full size balcony includes a BBQ & seating. TV/Internet/Heat included as well as secure underground parking. Bike lanes and public transit at your door.
neighborhood_overview: Old Town Victoria offers world class dining, shopping, and amenities all blended with a unique heritage and west coast charm with the Inner Harbour at your doorstep.  Enjoy mornings at local coffee shops and bakeries, lunch at one of the many Asian inspired restaurants and evenings strolling along the water before having a drink at one of the local breweries or cocktail bars. Lots of recreational and fitness options with yoga and spin classes close by or rent a paddle board or kayak and cruise the Pacific Ocean.
host_about: Hey there! We are two friends who own this condo together in beautiful Victoria. We have a joint passion for wellness, travel, and great food. We hope you enjoy this vibrant city as much as we do. Please enjoy your stay!

name: East Sooke Tree House
description: Wake up to fresh, local coffee in the trees. Spend the day hiking and exploring the beaches and trails of beautiful East Sooke Park with your furry friends. Finish the day by the fire or in the outdoor tub amongst giant conifers. A treehouse sleepover fit for adults. Glamping at its finest.
neighborhood_overview:
We are a five minutes’ drive to the Pike Road entrance and ten minutes’ drive to the Aylard Farm entrance of East Sooke Park. The park features a rugged and challenging, 10k coastal trail; inland mountain trails, and an endless combination of loops, hills, caves, points, fields, and cabins to explore. The park is off-leash friendly.

If you’re up for a bit of a scenic drive, head out to Metchosin and visit Devonian Park or Witty’s Lagoon, and stop for a meal at Mychosen Cafe/Mychosen Pizza and dessert at the Sugar Shack (milkshakes and pizza is our Sunday ritual).

We are fairly removed from town and would recommend stocking up on food in Langford before making your way out here.
host_about: Outdoor adventurer.

name: Studio Suite on the Gorge Waterway
description:
Beautiful one bedroom suite with full bathroom situated on the famous Gorge Waterway in Esquimalt, 10 minutes from downtown Victoria. You have access to the Gorge with the use of kayaks and a paddle board. There is also a swimming pool that is available for quest use on request. This is a quiet private residential area with parking available.
In the warmer months there is a lovely outside sitting area to enjoy the wonderful views.
Two coffee shops near by.
A very quiet residential area.

description: Welcome to rural living on the West Coast. Enjoy your stay in this 1400 SqFt rancher with three bedrooms, and one full bathroom on nearly an acre. name: Studio in Charming Manor near DT, Free Parking
description:
Business Licence #00039505

Cozy studio at Larkspur Manor Suites located in the heart of Fairfield, a sought-after historic neighbourhood in Victoria. This fantastic location is within walking distance to all levels of amenities, restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, tourist attractions, Cook Street Village, Beacon Hill Park, Downtown, Dallas Road waterfront, and transit. Whether it's for short or long stays, this fully furnished suite offers the comfort of a home away from home.
neighborhood_overview: Location, location, a perfect location!  Our well-maintained beautiful heritage manor is located in the heart of Fairfield, a charming walkable neighbourhood with many century-old heritage homes on quiet tree-lined streets leading to the Salish Sea, to the famous waterfront Dallas Road, Clover Point Park, and many beaches including picturesque Gonzales Bay, and dramatic views of the Olympic Mountains. Our property is steps to Cook Street Village, a lively strip featuring laid-back eateries, cafés, sidewalk patio, grocery stores, and small local shops.  Only a few blocks from us are the vibrant and popular Moss Street Market, a weekly summer outdoor market, with stalls of local produce and crafts. For anyone who appreciates Victorian, Edwardian, and Craftsman homes, or who wants a change of pace from the hustle and bustle of Downtown, look no further than this unique neighbourhood.  The proximity to Downtown, the water front, parks including the Beacon Hill Park, many attractions, ameni
host_about: I am outgoing, friendly, and respectful.  I love travelling, photography, trying out new food, and meeting new people.  When I am not busy taking care of my business, I enjoy going for walks and hikes with my family and our dog, Cosmo.

name: One of a kind converted 1969 School Bus
description:
This is a 1969 school bus lovingly converted into a tiny guest house in a whimsical garden space.
We are located in a rural residential area near Sooke BC, just off the Galloping Goose Trail. (Km37)
Surrounded by stunning beaches, pristine forest and coastal hikes, refreshing lakes and rivers, wildlife and natural beauty galore. A 30 minute drive from Victoria, or approximately 3 hour bike ride if you’re feeling adventurous.
neighborhood_overview:
The Galloping Goose Trail access is 2 minutes away, and you can hike or bike to Matheson Lake, Roche Cove, or the Sooke Potholes. There are countless gorgeous side trails, creeks, viewpoints and beaches along the way.

You can also drive, bike or walk to:
-Adrenaline Zip Line
-Rush Adventures (SUP/Kayak rentals)
-Stickleback Restaurant
-Sooke Oceanside Brewery
-17 Mile Pub/Liquorstore
-Daniel's Market (Farm Fresh Grocery Store)

There’s a bottomless pit of other local beaches and places to discover if you look up the route from Sooke to Port Renfrew. Check out my guidebook for some recommendations.

neighborhood_overview:
THE COTTAGE COMMUNITY
While residing in the Cottage, you are also a guest of the Wild Coast Cottage Community. The Community includes privately owned cottages, some of which are rented nightly while others are used exclusively by their owners. The Guest acknowledges, reads and agrees to follow the Bylaws & Rules of the Cottage Community as posted in the Welcome Letter in the cottage. This includes but is not limited to the proper care and use of the wastewater management system (Septic Treatment Plant) and includes consideration to occupying no more than the available parking space(s) allotted to the cottage

NOISE: EXCESSIVE NOISE AND DISTURBANCE OF OTHER COTTAGE OWNERS AND RENTERS WILL NOT BE TOLERATED. ANY GUEST CREATING A DISTURBANCE IN THE COMMUNITY WILL BE ASKED TO LEAVE IMMEDIATELY WITH NO REFUND.
